sense.name: clap hands together
sense.commentary: NP1[agent] APPLAUD (NP2[theme]) NOTE: compare to sense 2; this sense may be viewed as a subset, as clapping hands in one means of expressing approval; only literal, physical events of applause should be tagged with this sense
sense.examples: Cheney was booed and Sheen was applauded. (passive) Some of the crowd applauded before catcalls and boos could be heard. She ended the day on a high note, as Simon and Paula both applauded her performance. The candidate the audience was applauding enthusiastically went to the podium.

sense.name: praise, express approval of
sense.examples: Vietnam's commitment to bird flu fight has been applauded. Analysts have applauded Hurd's performance since he took NCR's helm two years ago. He applauds the efficiency and organization of the heirarchy.
